summary: Project scope update: enhance the ‚ÄúSend a Message‚Äù in-app messaging so users message the admin identity ‚ÄúMARIO‚Äù (replies display MARIO as sender, and MARIO‚Äôs avatar uses the current Home channel banner image). Admin online status is displayed Instagram-style (green dot + ‚Äúonline‚Äù when Hidden Admin Mode is ON; gray dot + ‚Äúoffline‚Äù when Hidden Admin Mode is OFF). Implement message seen/read receipts for both sides and ensure unread notification dots clear after messages are seen. Maintain a single per-user conversation thread (Normal Message + Custom Song Request via a fillable form + optional free-text) and remove any separate admin inbox UI view while still allowing the admin (when Hidden Admin Mode is ON) to see the list of all user conversations and reply within the same thread. Add file attachments to messages (images, MP3s, PDFs). Keep user hard-deletion of their own messages; allow MARIO (Hidden Admin Mode) to delete any messages (user or admin) and delete entire conversations via a delete icon on each user conversation card. Additionally, update auth/account so first launch requires Internet Identity login + required profile completion (full name, username, date of birth) and show this under a new ‚ÄúAccount‚Äù sidebar area along with total listening time aggregated across songs played. Hidden Admin Mode activation must support BOTH Ctrl+Shift+U and a 5-second long-press on the Home banner image (especially for mobile), using the same passcode + backend verification flow. In conversation threads, display the user‚Äôs chosen username as the user identity label.
architectural_notes: Use standard Caffeine stack: React + TypeScript + Tailwind (frontend) and Motoko (backend).
UI rule: if component background is neon green (#1ED760), force text/icons to black (#000000); otherwise use white on dark backgrounds; ensure contrast checks.
A2HS banner behavior: Close hides for current session only; banner reappears on next visit/session.
Night mode bottom tab styling override: inactive tab icons/text = #FFFFFF; active tab bg = #1ED760 with text/icons #000000; smooth transitions; Day mode unchanged.
Night mode input fields must render typed/input text as #FFFFFF (Day mode remains black).
Night mode sidebar interactive items: active (neon background) => black text/icons; inactive/dark => white text/icons; apply consistently across all sidebar items.
Song model/UI: add a separate per-song Title Image (file upload or URL) in addition to existing Cover Image; show Title Image on song card alongside cover image and in player.

Bottom navigation/tab bar color rules update (apply to BOTH mobile + desktop): Night mode inactive icon/label = #FFFFFF; active tab bg = #1ED760 with icon/label #000000. Day mode inactive icon/label = #000000; active tab bg = #1ED760 with icon/label #000000. Colors only; keep existing icon assets/sizes; smooth transitions; no other layout/behavior changes.
Desktop: BottomTabBar should render and be always visible (same as mobile; layout/spacing unchanged, only scaled for desktop).

Admin authorization model change: remove/disable Internet Identity principal-based admin checks; Admin Mode is unlocked via hidden key combo (Ctrl+Shift+U) + required passcode modal, with backend-side verification against a stored passcode hash.

Implement a Hidden Admin Mode activation flow in the React app that is triggered by the secret key combo Ctrl + Shift + U and ALWAYS prompts for a passcode in a modal before enabling Admin Mode. The passcode must be exactly: A1B2D3ABD.

Create a new frontend Admin Mode state manager (context/provider) that replaces the current adminPrincipal-based admin detection. Admin Mode state must be independent of Internet Identity (no principal-based admin checks).

Persist Hidden Admin Mode enabled state in a storage-backed way (session-only or localStorage) so that Admin Mode remains enabled according to the chosen persistence behavior, and can be explicitly cleared by the user.

Replace all existing frontend admin gating (AdminContext/useIsAdmin/AdminOnly/AdminGate usages) so that admin-only UI elements are shown/hidden solely based on the new Hidden Admin Mode state. This must include admin entry points currently gated in components like the Add Song UI and Home banner editing controls.

Update frontend actor calls and React Query mutations for all admin-only backend methods so they supply the admin passcode (or equivalent verified admin credential) as required by the updated backend API, using the new Hidden Admin Mode state as the source of truth.

Ensure existing Internet Identity-based authentication flows remain intact for normal user-restricted actions (likes, favorites, playlists, downloads), and that Hidden Admin Mode does not replace or break these user authentication requirements.

Update authorization error parsing/mapping so that admin-passcode-related backend authorization failures are recognized as admin-required (not sign-in-required), and display appropriate English user-facing messaging without routing into the soft sign-in modal flow.

Update the frontend Hidden Admin Mode enable flow so that Admin Mode is only considered enabled after the backend confirms the passcode is valid for admin operations (i.e., prevent a ‚Äúfrontend says Admin Mode ON‚Äù state when the backend will still reject admin mutations).

Fix the Add Song submission path so that when Admin Mode is enabled and the user adds a song (including cases where audio/title image were provided via file upload -> data URL conversion), the request includes the admin passcode credential required by the backend and the song is created successfully.

Improve admin authorization error messaging for admin-only actions so the UI can distinguish between (a) Admin Mode not enabled, (b) missing passcode credential, and (c) backend passcode rejection, while keeping the existing exact message text ‚ÄúYou do not have permission to perform this action.‚Äù for true admin authorization failures where required by existing behavior.

Add a new Login/Logout control to the existing sidebar navigation (`frontend/src/components/navigation/Sidebar.tsx`) that uses the current Internet Identity hook for authentication: when the user is not authenticated, show a button labeled ‚ÄúLogin‚Äù that triggers Internet Identity login; when the user is authenticated, show a button labeled ‚ÄúLogout‚Äù that logs the user out. This control must work in both the mobile drawer sidebar and the desktop sidebar, and clicking it must close the mobile drawer (same behavior as navigation and Add to Home Screen).
Make each playlist card in Library ‚Üí Playlists fully clickable so clicking/tapping the card opens a dedicated playlist detail view that shows the songs inside that playlist.

Implement the playlist detail view to render all songs in the playlist using existing song row components and existing playback behavior, so that selecting a song from the playlist starts playback in the existing MusicPlayer within the playlist context.

On the playlist detail view, add a playlist-level Play button and Spotify-like controls for Shuffle, Repeat, and Play Mode; these controls must affect the playlist‚Äôs playback order when using Next/Previous and when starting playback from the playlist-level Play button.

Add an Admin-Mode-only ‚ÄúCreate Official Playlist‚Äù button in Library ‚Üí Playlists, positioned beside the ‚ÄúOfficial Playlists‚Äù section header; it must only appear when Hidden Admin Mode is enabled and must not be visible to normal users or guests.

Support listing and opening Official Playlists: show a real list of official playlists in the ‚ÄúOfficial Playlists‚Äù section, allow clicking an official playlist card to open the same playlist detail view, and load its songs using backend APIs intended for official playlists.
Update the About the Artist screen to render its bio text and the three social links (YouTube, Instagram, Buy Me a Coffee) from the backend Artist/About profile instead of hard-coded strings/URLs.

Implement a dedicated on-page Admin Editing UI on the About the Artist page that is visible only when Hidden Admin Mode is enabled. The editor must allow editing the bio text and the three links (YouTube, Instagram, Buy Me a Coffee) and saving them to the backend using the admin passcode from Hidden Admin Mode.

Ensure admin-edit About profile failures are handled cleanly in the UI: if the backend rejects the update due to missing/invalid admin passcode, show an English error message and do not route the user into the soft sign-in modal (this is admin-required, not user-auth-required).

Update the in-app header branding (`frontend/src/components/branding/AppHeader.tsx`) so the header icon uses the exact same logo image as the app‚Äôs install/favicon icon (currently referenced as `/assets/icon-192.png` in `frontend/index.html`), replacing the current Lucide `Music` icon. Keep the existing header layout/styling unchanged (image swap only), including the same sizing, rounded container, spacing, and text.

Update the existing Add-to-Home-Screen install prompt logic to follow the standard `beforeinstallprompt` flow: listen for `beforeinstallprompt`, preventDefault, store the event for later use, and expose a callable `promptInstall()` that triggers `event.prompt()` and reads `event.userChoice` to determine whether the user accepted or dismissed the install.

Only show any ‚ÄúAdd to Home Screen‚Äù button/banner UI when PWA installation is supported and the app is not already installed; do not render the UI when running in standalone mode (already installed) or when `beforeinstallprompt` is not available.

Update the existing top A2HS banner component to display a call-to-action labeled exactly ‚ÄúAdd to Home Screen‚Äù (English) and hide the banner after the user clicks install (regardless of accepted/dismissed). The banner must work on both mobile and desktop.

Update the sidebar ‚ÄúAdd to Home Screen‚Äù navigation/control so it is only rendered (or is disabled with no action) when install is supported and the app is not installed, and ensure triggering it does not throw errors when `beforeinstallprompt` is unavailable.

Add a small standalone reference snippet (HTML + minimal CSS + JavaScript) to the frontend codebase that demonstrates the requested behavior in plain DOM terms (listen for `beforeinstallprompt`, show/hide ‚ÄúAdd to Home Screen‚Äù button conditionally, call `prompt()`, handle accepted/dismissed). This snippet must use English-only user-facing text.

Update the sidebar navigation so it always shows a single button labeled exactly ‚ÄúInstall App‚Äù (English) in both the mobile drawer sidebar and the desktop sidebar, replacing the current conditional sidebar ‚ÄúAdd to Home Screen‚Äù entry.

Implement the new sidebar ‚ÄúInstall App‚Äù click behavior: when clicked, trigger the PWA install prompt if available; otherwise show a toast notification with the exact message ‚ÄúApp is already installed or installation is not supported.‚Äù

Keep the existing top Add-to-Home-Screen banner behavior and rules unchanged (including its conditional visibility rules, session-only dismissal, and existing install checks). Do not modify `frontend/src/components/pwa/A2HSBanner.tsx` behavior as part of this change.

Ensure the sidebar ‚ÄúInstall App‚Äù button does not rely on `beforeinstallprompt` for UI visibility decisions (it must be always visible), but may still use existing `useA2HS` state to decide whether to prompt vs show the fallback toast on click.

Add React Query mutations/hooks for deleting (a) a user playlist and (b) an official playlist, wired to the new backend canister methods, and ensure query caches for playlist lists/details are invalidated/refetched after deletion.

Update the Library ‚Üí Playlists UI playlist cards to include a delete (trash) icon button with the correct visibility and click behavior: user playlist cards show a delete icon for signed-in users; official playlist cards show a delete icon only when Hidden Admin Mode is enabled; clicking the delete icon must not open the playlist card.
Add a confirmation step before deleting a playlist (user or official) to prevent accidental deletion, using English-only user-facing text.

Add frontend user messaging UI: a contact message composer form with fields Name, Email or phone number, Optional social link, and Message text; submitting sends a message to the backend and then shows the conversation thread in-app.

Add a user inbox entry point via a small inbox icon in the app header that appears only when the user has messages/replies to read; clicking it opens the user‚Äôs in-app conversation inbox/thread view.

Add frontend admin inbox UI visible only when Hidden Admin Mode is enabled: show a mail/inbox icon entry point, list all user conversations (sender name + contact details), open a conversation, and send replies; replies must appear for the user in their inbox view.

Integrate custom song requests into the same in-app conversation thread: provide a way from the Custom Song Requests screen to open the in-app messaging composer/thread with a request context, without creating a separate conversation.
Update frontend message notification behavior so that when the admin replies, the user sees the header inbox icon (and any unread indicator) and can read replies inside the app.

Ensure authorization and offline/admin-online rules match the specification: admin offline is determined by Hidden Admin Mode being disabled (no real-time presence), and the auto-reply logic is triggered accordingly without exposing admin contact details by default.

Update the frontend admin messaging hooks and admin inbox UI to use the passcode-gated backend messaging APIs consistently: admin conversation list, admin open conversation, and admin reply must all supply the Hidden Admin Mode passcode (from HiddenAdminModeContext) to the backend methods that require it.

Ensure frontend authorization error messaging for admin messaging failures is correct and does not mis-route the user into any sign-in-required flow: admin messaging failures must show an English permission/passcode-related message (and not trigger the soft sign-in modal).

Rename the sidebar navigation item currently labeled ‚ÄúContact‚Äù to be labeled exactly ‚ÄúSend a Message‚Äù, and keep it as the single entry point for in-app messaging (no separate ‚ÄúContact‚Äù label).

Update the ‚ÄúSend a Message‚Äù screen (currently `frontend/src/pages/ContactScreen.tsx`) to present exactly two message types: ‚ÄúNormal Message‚Äù and ‚ÄúCustom Song Request‚Äù. Selecting either type must show a structured, fillable layout with predefined fields plus an optional free-text field, and submitting either type must post into the same single per-user conversation thread in chronological order.

Persist the structured message submission in a consistent, readable format inside the conversation thread (single message content) so that the predefined fields and optional free-text are visible when viewing messages on both the user thread view (`frontend/src/components/messaging/MessageThread.tsx`) and the admin thread view (`frontend/src/components/messaging/AdminInboxDrawer.tsx`).

Implement permanent (hard) deletion of a user‚Äôs own messages from the conversation thread: users must be able to delete messages they sent, and deletion must remove the message from the thread with no placeholder entry.

Add admin moderation deletion: when Hidden Admin Mode is enabled, the admin conversation view must show a delete (cross) icon in the corner of each user-authored message, allowing the admin to remove unwanted user messages. Admin deletion must not require Internet Identity admin principal checks; it must be authorized using the Hidden Admin Mode passcode (same passcode gating style used by other admin mutations).

Fix admin messaging backend API usage so the admin can reliably: (1) list all conversations, (2) open a user conversation thread, and (3) reply to a user‚Äîusing passcode-gated backend APIs consistently. Update frontend admin messaging hooks to call passcode-accepting backend methods (removing reliance on the currently-called methods that are commented as backend bugs).

Keep the existing first-launch welcome popup behavior exactly as-is, and do not add a conversation-thread welcome message. The ‚Äúwelcome message on first launch‚Äù requirement refers only to the existing first-launch popup.

Require users to sign in with Internet Identity before they can use account features and messaging, and add a required account profile completion flow that collects: full name, user name, and date of birth. Persist these fields to the backend user profile record and re-prompt until completed.

Add an ‚ÄúAccount‚Äù section in the sidebar UI that displays the signed-in user‚Äôs personal details (full name, user name, date of birth) and the total listening time (hours/minutes) aggregated across songs played.

Implement total listening time tracking per user and persist it in the backend so it survives reloads. Listening time must be aggregated across all songs a user has played and displayed in hours/minutes in the sidebar Account section.
Update the in-app messaging UI so that users are messaging a single admin identity named ‚ÄúMARIO‚Äù, and all admin replies display ‚ÄúMARIO‚Äù as the sender name for the user.

Use the current Home channel banner image as MARIO‚Äôs profile picture/avatar everywhere MARIO is shown in the messaging UI (thread header, message bubbles if avatars are shown, and any conversation list items).

Display MARIO‚Äôs online status in the messaging UI in an Instagram-like style: a green dot with the text ‚Äúonline‚Äù under his name when Hidden Admin Mode is ON, and a gray dot with the text ‚Äúoffline‚Äù when Hidden Admin Mode is OFF.

Remove the separate Admin Inbox UI as a distinct drawer/view and replace it with a single unified messaging drawer experience: each signed-in user has a single conversation thread; when Hidden Admin Mode is ON, MARIO can also access the list of all user conversations and open any one, but replies and reading happen in the same thread UI (no separate ‚Äòadmin inbox‚Äô screen).
Implement message seen/read receipt functionality for both sides so both the user and MARIO can tell when messages have been read, and ensure unread indicators clear after messages are seen.

Add support for file attachments in messages for both users and MARIO: allow attaching images, MP3 audio files, and PDFs; store attachments in a deployment-safe way; render attachments appropriately in the conversation thread.

Allow message deletion with the following rules: users can hard-delete their own sent messages; when Hidden Admin Mode is ON, MARIO can delete any message (user-authored or MARIO-authored) in any conversation thread.
Allow MARIO (Hidden Admin Mode) to delete entire conversations via a delete icon shown on each user conversation card in the admin conversation list.

Combine Custom Song Request messaging into the same ‚ÄúSend a Message‚Äù entry point: keep exactly two message types (‚ÄúNormal Message‚Äù and ‚ÄúCustom Song Request‚Äù) with a structured fillable form plus optional free-text, and remove any separate admin inbox entry point and any separate Custom Song Requests messaging entry point.

Update first-launch onboarding and account gating so that on first launch the user must sign in with Internet Identity (no guest path) and must complete personal details (full name, user name, date of birth) before accessing messaging and account features; keep all user-facing text in English.

Ensure message notification dot behavior is correct for both user and admin contexts: the inbox/messages icon shows a red unread indicator only when there are unread messages for the currently active role (user unread MARIO replies; admin unread user messages), and the dot clears immediately after the messages are marked as seen.

Implement an additional Hidden Admin Mode activation method: a press-and-hold (long-press) gesture on the Home channel banner image area that, after a continuous 5 seconds, opens the existing Admin passcode modal (the same modal used by the Ctrl+Shift+U shortcut) so the admin can enter the existing passcode and enable Admin Mode. This long-press trigger must work on both mobile (touch) and desktop (mouse/pointer), must not replace or modify the existing Ctrl+Shift+U shortcut behavior, and must not interfere with normal song playback/navigation interactions elsewhere on the Home screen.
Fix and complete frontend ‚Äúseen‚Äù (read receipt) behavior so the unread notification dot and the per-message ‚ÄúSeen‚Äù indicator behave like Instagram for both user and admin contexts.

Update the conversation thread UI so that the user‚Äôs identity label in messages uses the user‚Äôs chosen username (from the required user profile) instead of generic labels, and ensure the admin view also displays the same username when viewing a user conversation.
Ensure MARIO‚Äôs online/offline status indicator renders exactly as specified and updates immediately when Hidden Admin Mode state changes, without requiring navigation or reload.

Complete message deletion UX and authorization handling: users can hard-delete their own sent messages; when Hidden Admin Mode is ON, MARIO can hard-delete any message (user or MARIO) and delete entire conversations; error handling must show clear English messages and must not incorrectly route into the soft sign-in flow for admin-passcode failures.
Ensure file attachments (images, MP3, PDFs) work end-to-end in messaging: pick/validate, send, store, and render attachments correctly for both user messages and MARIO replies.

Fix admin unread detection logic so the header unread indicator reflects actual unread user messages (not merely ‚Äúhas any conversations‚Äù), and ensure unread state clears immediately after messages are marked as seen.

Fix the global auth state so the app correctly treats an Internet Identity signed-in user as authenticated for all restricted actions (Like, Add to Favorites, Create Playlist, Add to Playlist, offline cache, device download, messaging), preventing the soft sign-in modal from appearing when the sidebar already shows the user is logged in.

Update `frontend/src/context/AuthContext.tsx` so `isAuthenticated` is derived from the actual Internet Identity state (`useInternetIdentity().identity`) rather than being hard-coded false, and ensure the AuthContext stays in sync when identity changes (login/logout).

Fix the soft sign-in modal "Sign In with Internet Identity" button so it reliably triggers the Internet Identity login flow and does not appear ‚Äústuck‚Äù (no-op) when tapped/clicked. Ensure the modal closes automatically when authentication succeeds and does not immediately re-open for the same action once signed in.

Ensure pending restricted actions complete correctly after successful authentication: when a restricted action triggers `requireAuth(...)`, after sign-in succeeds the app retries the pending action once and then clears pending state so the modal does not reappear for subsequent actions.

Standardize restricted-action routing to `requireAuth(...)` only when the user is truly unauthenticated (anonymous) or when the backend returns a sign-in-required error; do not route signed-in users into the soft sign-in flow for non-auth issues. Keep user-facing text in English.
